content:
I can tell you that the changes in management structure of the dallas cowboys have had varying degrees of success in improving the team's performance:

1. the hiring of will mcclay and the restructuring of the scouting department has led to an improvement in the team's drafting and player development, with several young players such as dak prescott and ezekiel elliott making an impact and being selected for the pro bowl. 2. the hiring of kellen moore as offensive coordinator in 2019 led to an improvement in the team's offense, which finished the season ranked in the top 10 in total offense. 3. however, the team has struggled to reach the playoffs consistently in recent years, with only 2 playoff appearances since 2010. 4. there has also been criticism of jerry jones' continued involvement in team management and decision making, with some arguing that it has hampered the team's ability to succeed. overall, there have been some positive changes in the management structure of the dallas cowboys that have led to some improvements on the field, but the team still faces challenges in achieving consistent success.
